reasoning: Reporting incidence. Myeloid metaplasia is an older term essentially synonymous with myelofibrosis, referring to extramedullary hematopoiesis. Using same estimate as myelofibrosis (~0.8 per 100k), though this term is less commonly used in modern literature.
source: Rollison DE et al. (2008). Epidemiology of myelodysplastic syndromes and chronic myeloproliferative disorders in the United States, 2001-2004. Br J Haematol. 142(3):395-404
